title: 2 Simple Ways to Dry Fresh Coconut Meat

steps.title: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (177 degrees C).
steps.content: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (177 degrees C).

steps.title: Drill the coconut through the eyes using a 3/8 inch (9.5 mm) drill bit.
steps.content: Drill the coconut through the eyes using a 3/8 inch (9.5 mm) drill bit. Pour the coconut water into a dish or cup. The water should be clear. Cloudy or colored water means the coconut is bad. You can discard the water or drink it if desired. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Put the coconut directly on the rack in the preheated oven.
steps.content: Put the coconut directly on the rack in the preheated oven. Heat the coconut for 20 minutes.

steps.title: Remove the coconut from the oven and wrap it in a towel, creating a sack.
steps.content: Remove the coconut from the oven and wrap it in a towel, creating a sack. Hold the end of the towel to keep the coconut stable and hit the coconut several times with a hammer to break it up.

steps.title: Pry the flesh out of the coconut with a strong knife, such as a paring knife.
steps.content: Pry the flesh out of the coconut with a strong knife, such as a paring knife. The flesh may have a thin brown skin attached from where it was touching the shell. Remove the skin with a vegetable peeler. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Reduce the oven temperature to 250 degrees F (121 degrees C).
steps.content: Reduce the oven temperature to 250 degrees F (121 degrees C).

steps.title: Shred the coconut pieces in a food processor and dry them for 10-15 minutes.
steps.content: Shred the coconut pieces in a food processor and dry them for 10-15 minutes. Spread the coconut pieces on a cookie sheet in an even layer. Place the cookie sheet in the oven and dry the coconut for 10-15 more minutes. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Let the dried coconut cool and transfer it to an airtight container.
steps.content: Let the dried coconut cool and transfer it to an airtight container. Store the coconut in a cool, dry place, preferably your fridge. Your shredded coconut can be safely stored for 6 to 8 months.

steps.title: Bust up the coconut shell with a hammer.
steps.content: Bust up the coconut shell with a hammer. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Peel the fleshy innards out of the coconut.
steps.content: Peel the fleshy innards out of the coconut.

steps.title: Use a cheese grater to grate the flesh.
steps.content: Use a cheese grater to grate the flesh. Rub the flesh against the coarse side of the grater, taking care not to cut yourself. If you want the dried coconut to be a little sweet, sprinkle 1-2 tsp of sugar on it.

steps.title: Dehydrate the shredded coconut for about 8 hours at 135 째F (57 째C).
steps.content: Dehydrate the shredded coconut for about 8 hours at 135 째F (57 째C). [5] X Research source

steps.title: Bag the dried coconut.
steps.content: Bag the dried coconut. Use an airtight container or an airtight resealable bag. Store the coconut in a cool, dry place (you can also put it in the fridge). Shredded dry coconut will stay fresh for 6 to 8 months.
